entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: The main antagonist of the story, described as having red eyes and fighting to break a thread of light connecting his wand with Harry's. (Excerpt: 'Harry saw his red eyes wide with astonishment at what was happening...')

entities.name: death eaters
entities.description: A group of followers of Voldemort, described as circling like jackals and having their cries muffled. (Excerpt: 'cage of light, beyond which the Death Eaters circled like jackals...')

entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main protagonist of the story, described as holding onto Voldemort's wand tightly and feeling a sense of hope when he hears the phoenix song. (Excerpts: 'Harry held onto his wand more tightly...'; 'He felt as though')

entities.name: phoenix
entities.description: A creature that is associated with a beautiful and welcome sound, described as the phoenix song. (Excerpt: 'It was the sound of hope to Harry...the most beautiful and welcome thing he had ever heard in his life.')

relationships.description: Voldemort is commanding the Death Eaters not to do anything unless he commands them. (Excerpt: '“Do nothing!” Voldemort shrieked to the Death Eaters...')
Voldemort's wand is connected to Harry's through a thread of light, which Harry holds onto tightly. (Excerpt: 'Harry held onto his wand more tightly...')

The phoenix song is associated with Voldemort, as it is a sound that fills the air when the threads of light are vibrating around him and Harry. (Excerpt: 'It was coming from every thread of the light-spun web vibrating around Harry and Voldemort...')
